It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: 1811 Sep. 19, [to] James Winchester, Sumner County, Tennessee / John R. Eaton
bibl.author: Eaton, John R.
bibl.note: This is a letter from Major John R. Eaton to General James Winchester, dated September 19, 1811. Eaton writes about the effect on trade with Spain and Portugal in relation to England. He also expresses concern about the possibility of war with England. Eaton reports that a British naval ship is off the coast.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
Some time past the answer to Mr. Seareys paper was sent out, by the Virginia route & also by the
No North Carolina line- I hope they Safely reached their destination_ when the division takes place, please inform me of the result ___

our commercial prospects have been greatly clarified, by the proceedings of England_ the price of Tob Tobacco : at Petes g is 13/6 pr per 100- wheat 5/to 6/ the price of flour and other provisions are much reduced atCadiz & Lisbon from the great quantity sent to those places__ we have only furnished the Beligerents Billigerents with one fortieth of their provisions last year_ our crops of corn this year are abundant, the Tob: indifferent from the wet Season__ my friend Mr Macon seems to think we may probably be involved in war Sir Joseph York is off our coast for the Purpose of annoying our hold or blocading blockading our Ports__ we are still very Democratic in this Quarter_ with our best respects to Mrs. Winchester& your children

closer.salute: I remain dear General much genuinely yours
closer.add:
Fav favored by
Jno. John Vandyke }
